page.title: 13ILMINGTON LAKES
page.content: Two silted lakes were reopened in {Berry Orchard}in 1978.The depth of both lakes is several feet.Mr.Flower owns the lakes.The machines used to dig the lakes were a bulldozer and a dragline.Rainbow trout and brown trout can be found in the lakes which have attracted all sorts of wild fowl.There are moor-hens,coots,Canada geese with goslings and ducks with ducklings too. The lakes have also attracted herons. These flowers can be seen around the lakes: yellow flags,clover,purple vetch,ivy flower,bullrush,deadnettle, reeds,dandelions,goosegrass,daisies, duckweed.
